title: Patient Name
instruction: Extract the patientâ€™s full name exactly as it appears in the transcript.

title: Chief Complaint
instruction: Provide only the patient's chief complaint.

title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient presents for evaluation of bilateral thumb pain, which has worsened since his last visit in 2019 and significantly over the past six months. He reports no numbness or tingling but experiences significant pain limiting his thumbs.
instruction: Summarize HPI with onset, duration, location, severity.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Bilateral upper extremty skin is clean, dry and intact. No significant soft tissue swelling, positive Grin, positive shoulder sign, no triggering of any digits with the thumb.

title: Imaging Results
content: X-rays demonstrate severe joint space neovasculitis with osteophytosis and Z deformity on the right; left shows similar findings without calcific arteriogram.

title: Plan
content: Discuss steroid effects and rebound pain.
